title: [PATCH] Gazebo 1.5 - SensorContainer::RunLoop() - Default maxUpdateRate causes a large sleep time to be requested

content.raw:
I had an issue where my ContactSensor's were not returning any data, even though contact messages were being published through ~/physics/contacts (but not through the entities' topics). This behavior did not occur in Gazebo 1.4.
After putting in some breakpoints, I saw that ContactSensor::UpdateImpl() was not called, went through the call stack, and found that SensorContainer::RunLoop() (a new structure introduced in 1.5, it seems) was hanging at the condition variable's wait() after initialization.

Looked into it, and found that it hung due to the default sleep time = 1.0 / maxUpdateRate, with maxUpdateRate being GZ_DBL_MIN (~1e-308).
I've changed the time values in the patch included and the sensor container seems to run properly. I don't think these values make sense, but hopefully they help point out the issue.
